content: The RMS Titanic tragically sank on its maiden voyage in 1912 after hitting what type of natural obstacle?

The RMS Titanic tragically sank on its maiden voyage in 1912 after hitting an iceberg. The ship struck the iceberg on the night of April 14, 1912, and sank in the early hours of April 15, resulting in the loss of over 1,500 lives. This disaster remains one of the most infamous shipwrecks in history and has been the subject of numerous books, films, and documentaries.
